GRS ITEMS PROPOSED FOR USE: All email, other than item 010, will be managed under item 011. IMPLEMENTATION SCOPE: Office of Inspector General (OIG) is a component of record group 056 (Treasury Departmental Offices) but is independently implementing the Capstone approach with respect to its (component-level) email system. (A) Treasury components - separate Forms NA-1005: The following Treasury components (including bureaus and offices of Inspectors General) will submit separate Forms NA-1005 in anticipation of adopting the Capstone General Records Schedule (GRS 6.1) -- -- Alcohol and Tobacco Tax and Trade Bureau (Record Group 564) -- Bureau of Engraving and Printing (RG 318) -- Bureau of the Fiscal Service (RG 425) -- Community Development Financial Institutions Fund (RG 056)  -- Financial Crimes Enforcement Network (RG 559) -- Treasury Inspector General for Tax Administration (RG 056) -- Office of the Inspector General (RG 056) -- United States Mint (RG 104)(B) Other Treasury components: Please note the following -   -- Internal Revenue Service (RG 058) obtained a non-GRS records schedule (Standard Form 115) for email in October 2015 -- Office of the Comptroller of the Currency (RG 101) will obtain a non-GRS records schedule (SF 115) for email -- Office of the Special Inspector General for the Troubled Asset Relief Program (RG 056) is incorporated in this Form NA-1005(C) Other Departmental Offices: The Office of Foreign Assets Control within Departmental Offices will submit a separate Form NA-1005 under its separate records group (RG 265).(D) Administrative records for non-Capstone accounts: These records will be retained for seven years.
